Greetings...

I'm finding myself in a situation where I would like to create the
following type of test case:

- testing a web service via HTTP
- default testing of the service would require that the HTTP server is
started up on the local machine
- an additional way of executing the test would be to have the same HTTP
based tests execute against an assumed host/port that is already running
the HTTP server w/ the service.

We're currently using XmlTestCase as the base class for an HttpTestCase.
The former handles the XML that is returned from the service and the
later handles getting the response to and from the server to our tests.
I currently use an extension of TestSetup to setup the HTTP server for
the "default test execution".

I'm not sure how to proceed.  I'd assume that I may need to create my
own TestRunner to perform the "execute tests against remote server"
approach.  I don't want to go down a rat hole on this as I think there
is a chunk of basic Junit knowledge that I'm missing out on as to how to
best set up this pattern.

Can anyone lend a hand or point me at some examples of solutions that
fix similar problems?

Thanks in advance,

Tom
